instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Potential Gmux Issue
threads.message: [FONT=Whitney][SIZE=16px]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. External display works normally when eDP is unplugged. With eDP connected looks like this. Potential gmux issue? No signs of screen damage. Have yet to work on this model yet.[/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Potential Gmux Issue
threads.message: Looks like this one still has Apple Care on it. Going to have customer contact Apple. But still curious what the issue is. I believe I saw Rossmann do a video where the eDP connector had debris on the backlight and data line that killed the GMUX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Potential Gmux Issue
threads.message: GPU issue, certainly take to Apple if it does not have liquid damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Potential Gmux Issue
threads.message: Thanks Duke. The only reason I didn't suspect GPU is because with the eDP cable unplugged, using an external monitor, there were no graphical anomalies. Thankfully, this one still has a warranty until 2022.
